content: k1 p1 to the end of the round round 11 - k1 p1 k1 k2tog repeat to end of round 40 stitches round 2 - as round 1 round 12 - p2 p2tog repeat to end of round 30 round 3 - purl all stitches stitches repeat these 3 rounds until the hat measures 7 round 13 - k1 k2tog repeat to end of round 20 inches from the cast on edge ending on round 3 stitches round 14 - k2tog repeat to end of round 10 stitches crown decreases you will need to switch to your double pointed needles when the number of stitches is too few to work on your circular needle round 1 - k1 p1 4 times k2tog repeat to the end of round you will have decreased by 10 stitches and now have 90 stitches round 2 - k1 p1 4 times k1 repeat to end of round round 3 - p7 p2tog repeat to end of round 80 stitches round 4 - k1 p1 repeat to end of round round 5 - k1 p1 3 times k2tog repeat to end of round 70 stitches © 2017 kay jones angel hat for personal use only - do not reproduce bakerybears@btinternet com page 3 you can now cut your yarn leaving a tail of about 6 inches thread the end through a tapestry needle and run this around the last 10 stitches to secure i like to go around a couple of times and pull tight to make sure the end will not come loose the final thing to do is to weave in your two yarn ends and then wash and block your hat i made a pom pom with the leftover yarn which is always a welcome addition to a hat © 2017 kay jones angel hat for personal use only - do not reproduce bakerybears@btinternet com page 4
